conclusion: A enters from the lower-left and is aimed on a gentle up-right diagonal.
A's speed is low/medium, so it can push small cubes but will be stopped by the first medium or large block it meets.
The first block whose center lies directly on the diagonal path is the small orange cube about one car-length in front of A.

premise: The orange cube is lighter than the car.
conclusion: The orange cube is kicked forward a short distance upon collision.

premise: The impact produces almost no sideways impulse.
conclusion: The car’s nose continues on essentially the same line after pushing the orange cube.
The next obstacle on the same line is the green rectangular prism lying flat about 10–12 cm farther on.

premise: The car strikes the near left edge of the green prism.
conclusion: The prism’s mass is large enough that the car cannot push it out of the way.

premise: The hit is slightly off-center (left edge).
conclusion: A small counter-clockwise deflection is produced, but there is no room to swing past the block.

premise: The green prism barely moves (a few millimeters).
conclusion: The car’s wheels lose nearly all forward momentum in the second collision and stop with its front bumper touching the long side of the green prism, slightly angled left.

premise: A first taps the small orange cube, pushing it ahead a little, then runs straight into the green rectangular prism just beyond it.
conclusion: The car cannot shift the larger block and finally comes to rest with its nose against the near left edge of the green prism, a few centimeters above its initial diagonal path.
